comments.text:
User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b11) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b11
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b11) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0b11

Clicking the drop-down arrow -- beneath the "Find a store" heading -- for the "Area:" selector does not produce the expected list of areas. Indeed, the areas do not even seem to pre-load into the drop-down control.

Instead the drop-down box remains blank with the message "loading Store Types..." permanently displayed at its right-hand side.

This will probably affect many other sites with similar drop-down controls, and may be related to bug 587287, which apparently was thought to have been resolved, but seems not to be resolved in 4.0b11.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1.As in details above.
Actual Results:  
As in details above.

Expected Results:  
As in details above.

As in details above.
comments.creator: Patrick.Sedgwick@btinternet.com

comments.text:
Confirmed on
Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:2.0b13pre) Gecko/20110226 Firefox/4.0b13pre ID:20110226030401

However, It works if set "general.useragent.override" to "Mozilla/5.0 (Windows; U; Windows NT 6.1; en-US; rv:1.9.2.13) Gecko/20101102  Firefox/3.6.13".

So, I think this is the site problem

comments.text:
Bug 637135 persists in Firefox 4.0.1 as of 2011-04-30, and is demonstrable on the following web page:
http://www.nokia.co.uk/home/find-a-store/store-locator


Since Chrome (v 11.0.696.60) DOES work, as of this date, on the above web page, whereas current Firefox 4.0.1 does NOT work; and guided by Alice's comment that the two bugs 637135 and 600077 do not have the same root cause, I have re-opened this bug 637135.

If others more technically competent than I am consider this inappropriate, please feel free to intervene.
comments.creator: Patrick.Sedgwick@btinternet.com
comments.raw_text:
Bug 637135 persists in Firefox 4.0.1 as of 2011-04-30, and is demonstrable on the following web page:
http://www.nokia.co.uk/home/find-a-store/store-locator


Since Chrome (v 11.0.696.60) DOES work, as of this date, on the above web page, whereas current Firefox 4.0.1 does NOT work; and guided by Alice's comment that the two bugs 637135 and 600077 do not have the same root cause, I have re-opened this bug 637135.

If others more technically competent than I am consider this inappropriate, please feel free to intervene.
This seems 'Tech Evangelism'  according to Comment #1.
comments.creator: alice0775@gmail.com
comments.text: This seems 'Tech Evangelism'  according to Comment #1.
comments.author: alice0775@gmail.com

comments.text:
If I understand Comment 1 correctly, that seems to be suggesting that the problem lies with the website (Nokia's), and not with Firefox; and that Nokia should therefore be invited (through "Tech Evangelism") to make some technical correction to its site (http://www.nokia.co.uk/home/find-a-store/store-locator).

That seems illogical, because Chrome 11.0.696.60, Opera 11.01, and IE9.0.8112.16421 all function correctly with that URL; so, it would seem to me that the fault must lie with Firefox 4.0.1, and not with the site.

(N.B. This Bug, 637135, is not - at least functionally - a duplicate of Bug 600077, because:
-- the "Origin" drop-down on the relevant URL for Bug 600077 (https://tickets.airtran.com/RetrieveBooking.aspx) DOES work correctly in Firefox 4.0.1; whereas,
-- the "Area" drop down on the URL for Bug 637135 (http://www.nokia.co.uk/home/find-a-store/store-locator) does NOT work correctly in Firefox 4.0.1.)
comments.raw_text:

That seems illogical, because Chrome 11.0.696.60, Opera 11.01, and IE9.0.8112.16421 all function correctly with that URL; so, it would seem to me that the fault must lie with Firefox 4.0.1, and not with the site.

(N.B. This Bug, 637135, is not - at least functionally - a duplicate of Bug 600077, because:

comments.raw_text:
This bug was reported using a pre-release version of Firefox 4. Now that Firefox 4.0.1 final has been released, can you please update and retest your bug? A fresh profile would be a good starting place to test, 
http://support.mozilla.com/kb/Managing+profiles. If you continue to see the issue, can you please update this bug with your results?

Filter: firefox4prebugsunco

Re Comment 14: thank you for your prompting; I have retested the bug using Firefox 4.0.1 (as stated in Comment 13) and found it to be still present when visiting the Nokia URL given above. I have also tested it on a friend's machine (rather than mess around with my profile -- a dark area to me) using Firefox 4.0.1 and found the same symptoms present there too.
